entry.title: Reedsport hosts ribbon-cutting ceremony for new tiki room
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:25 a.m. The City of Reedsport is hosting a ribbon-cutting ceremony at the Hoaloha Tiki Room grand opening celebrations Saturday. Mayor Linda McCollum and City Manager Deanna Schafer will be on hand for the event. The event is scheduled from 5-6 p.m. It’s free and open to the public. Hoaloha Tiki Room...

entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products announces end of Hardwood Plywood Plant operations
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:25 a.m. Roseburg Forest Products has closed operations at its Dillard Hardwood Plywood facility and will exit the hardwood plywood market, the company announced Thursday. The Douglas County based lumber company said in a release that the decision was made to reflect the long-term plan for Roseburg Forest Products to concentrate resources...

entry.title: UNF removes public use restrictions
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:22 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has removed Public Use Restrictions as of Friday morning. Recent rainfall and cooler temperatures have allowed forest management to lift the restrictions and lower the fire danger level to “moderate.” The Industrial Fire Precaution Level will move to level 1 as of 12:01 a.m. Monday. With...

entry.title: “Ghosts of Roseburg” tours offered in October
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:20 a.m. With October and Halloween on the horizon, folks looking for a fright can put a “Ghosts of Roseburg” tour on their calendar. Event organizer Val Gordon said the tours bring to life downtown Roseburg’s dark and colorful spirits. Tour guides will take groups on an approximately 1.5 hour immersive experience...

entry.title: UNF rescinds emergency fire closure order
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:15 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has rescinded an Emergency Fire Closure Order that was impacting a small portion of the Diamond Lake Ranger District due to the Emigrant Fire. As of Friday, the Upper Lemolo Falls Trail #1476 and trailhead, Skipper Lakes Trailhead, Cinder Prairie Trailhead, Bulldog Rock Trailhead, Lemolo #2...

entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library’s fall youth program schedule includes activities for nearly every family.

entry.title: Sutherlin's Jennifer Bracken is Douglas' teacher of the year
entry.summary: SUTHELRIN — Jennifer Bracken said she likes teaching because she enjoys watching students learn new things and enjoy being at school.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest to Lift Emigrant Fire Emergency Closure
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest will lift the Emigrant Fire Emergency Closure on Friday, reopening trails like Upper Lemolo Falls and Skipper Lakes. Roads 2610 and 6000-700 remain closed. A related closure is still in effect on the Willamette National Forest.

entry.title: Coming Soon: New Tennis and Pickleball Courts at Stewart Park
entry.summary: Coming soon: Stewart Park will open brand-new courts this fall after a $2.5M renovation. The project adds 8 tennis courts, 10 pickleball courts, new seating, lighting, and accessibility upgrades. A ribbon-cutting ceremony will mark the grand opening once work is complete.

entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products Ends Hardwood Plywood Production in Dillard
entry.summary: Roseburg Forest Products will cease hardwood plywood production at its Dillard plant, exiting the market amid rising imports. About 110 jobs are affected, with workers encouraged to apply at other sites. The company will focus on core lines like engineered wood, MDF, lumber, and softwood plywood.

entry.title: Umpqua trails accessible again as fire closure ends
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest is set to rescind the Emigrant Fire Emergency Closure Order on Friday, according to forest officials.

entry.title: Roseburg Post Office hosting a hiring fair
entry.summary: Sept. 25, 2025 11:25 a.m. The United State Postal Service is holding a hiring fair at the Roseburg Post Office on Tuesday, Sept. 30. The News-Review reports that the hiring fair will cover two different positions with USPS; a rural carrier associate and an assistant rural carrier. Both positions have a starting salary of $20.85...

entry.title: Merkley and Wyden support Head Start for America’s Children Act
entry.summary: Sept. 25, 2025 11:20 a.m. Oregon’s U.S. Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden have joined their Senate colleagues to introduce the Head Start for America’s Children Act, the senators announced in a press release Thursday. They say the legislation would expand Head Start to ensure that more than 11 million young children from working-class families...

entry.title: Migrating Vaux’s Swifts Return to Roseburg; “Swift Watch” Back On
entry.summary: Migrating Vaux’s Swifts have returned to Roseburg, with about 1,000 roosting at the Clay Place chimney in Fir Grove Park. The Umpqua Valley Audubon Society will host free “Swift Watch” events Sept. 19 & 26 at 6:30 p.m., offering a chance to witness the spectacle at sunset.

entry.title: Emigrant Fire continues to burn a month later
entry.summary: Sept. 25, 2025 11:19 a.m. It’s been a month since a lightning storm sparked the Emigrant Fire south of Oakridge and north of Lemolo Lake in eastern Lane and Douglas Counties. As of Thursday, the fire is burning on 32,772 acres and is 41% contained. A total of 530 personnel is staffing the fire. A...

entry.title: DFPA announces more prescribed burning
entry.summary: Sept. 25, 2025 9:10 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association will resume prescribed burning Thursday around the Umpqua Basin. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said the relative humidity will fall within the safety range for prescribed fires, allowing the organization the opportunity to perform four burns in the area. entry.summary: GLIDE — Little Loggers Playschool in Glide will be moving locations by the end of September, but according to Glide Revitalization Executive Director Jeana Beam, it may need to close for a few weeks due to the move timeline.

entry.title: Travel spending dips in Douglas County
entry.summary: Sept. 24, 2025 11:55 a.m. Travel spending in Douglas County saw a small decrease in 2024 compared to the previous year, according to a recent study done by research firm Dean Runyan Associates. The firm reports that travelers spent $316.2 million in Douglas County in 2024, down almost $3 million from the same period in...

entry.title: Roseburg City Council passes on property for homeless
entry.summary: Sept. 24, 2025 11:50 a.m. The Roseburg City Council has withdrawn its support for an urban campground at a vacant lot on Southeast Stephens. Council members voted 6-2 to cancel the purchase of the old Reddaway trucking depot at their meeting Monday, according to The News-Review. Councilors Ellen Porter and Tom Michalek voted against cancelling...

entry.title: Roseburg City Council Rejects Campground Site, Releases Report, and Declines Fireworks Ban
entry.summary: Roseburg City Council voted 6-2 to cancel purchase of the Stephens St. site for a proposed urban campground, unanimously agreed to release the full Rummel investigation report, and rejected a citywide fireworks ban by a 6-2 vote. The next meeting is set for Oct. 13 at City Hall.

entry.title: Holly O'Dell recognized as Southern Region Juvenile Justice Professional of the Year
entry.summary: Working in juvenile justice is something of a balancing act. It requires both the strength to make youth take responsibility for their actions and the drive to promote their growth as citizens.

entry.title: Here's what to know about the emerald ash borer
entry.summary: The emerald ash borer was found for the first time in Portland over the summer, according to a press release from the Oregon Department of Forestry.
